the patient was placed in the supine position. under affects of general endotracheal anesthesia, head and neck were prepped and draped with phisohex solution and draped in the appropriate sterile fashion. a gull-wing incision was drawn over the forehead scalp.
hair was removed along the suture line and incision was made to skin and subcutaneous tissue of the scalp down to, but not including the pericranium.

the nasal pyramid was satisfactorily mobilized as well as the nasal septum and brought back to midline position with the help of a boies elevator for the septum.
